ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Discussion skills went through the roof
I learned how to write in a different way than I was used to and I considered so many ideas I never really thought about before.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Very engaging course if you actually choose to engage. If you are one of those quiet, afraid-to-speak people then you will struggle.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: My class definitely learned a lot of very interesting things we otherwise wouldn't have known

I would recommend this course to other students because learning about all these different philosophers in one course makes the connections between them more apparent, such as Plato's influence on Augustine, Aristotle's critiques of Plato's ideas, and Aristotle's influence on Arabic philosophers like Al-Farabi. This course is great for anyone who loves asking questions and is open to exploring different ideas.
